text:
Hi everyone! :sunny:

I want to know more about the different tools for marketing. What tools do you use for marketing and why?

elements.text: I want to know more about the different tools for marketing. What tools do you use for marketing and why?

text:
My stack includes:

Slack for chat / calls (best UI)
Trello for article planning (best usability)
G Suite - for article writing, reporting, etc (most conveninent over Word, Powerpoint)
InDesign - for design (inherited)
WordPress - to post blogs (inherited but prefer to Squarespace)
Asana - article planning from other clients (client uses)
Buffer - schedule social (inherited but best out of all I've tested)
MailChimp - email campaigns (inherited)
Whichever keyword tool is hot /free
HelloBar - for pop ups (suggested by colleague)

to name but a few!

text:
Tall order. Mine includes (and I am likely missing a few):

• Slack - chat in house and with vendors
• Zoom - video calls (we’ve all been remote for a while) and for webinars
• HubSpot - CRM, Marketing Automation and website
• G Suite - article writing (Docs) and Analytics (checking HubSpots Analytics
• Zapier and Piesync - Connecting together odds and ends that don’t want to naturally connect
• Outreach - Sales cadences and nurturing
• Canva - All things design related for items on the fly
• Drift - chatbot
• Appcues - Used for a guided tutorial in our trial product
• GaggleAMP - Employee advocacy (full disclosure, I work here and use our own product to manage social to employees)
• Monday - Project planning and communication for the leadership team
• Metabase - data manipulation and dashboard analytics
• Libsyn - podcast hosting
• Zencastr - podcast recording
• PlayPlay - Video creation for social
• Neverbounce - email verification
• SEMRush - SEO monitoring
• ZenDesk - Customer support
• Unbounce - landing pages
There are others, as well as a handful of vendors we trust with a variety of functions, too.

Zapier and Piesync - Connecting together odds and ends that don’t want to naturally connect

There are others, as well as a handful of vendors we trust with a variety of functions, too.

text: Intercom is another big one we use. For support queries and email sends.

elements.text: Intercom is another big one we use. For support queries and email sends.

text: I also use Transistor for personal podcasting and Audacity for audio editing.

elements.text: I also use Transistor for personal podcasting and Audacity for audio editing.

text: These are all great! Thank you all so much!

elements.text: These are all great! Thank you all so much!

text: Thank you <@U0109NWK58A>. Can you tell me more about the happy hour?

elements.text: . Can you tell me more about the happy hour?

text: <@U0105JEFJ1F> sure. Typically speaking our office-based team would go out for happy hour on Thursday or Friday after work. They simply moved that online. Someone will set up a Zoom call and everyone meets to enjoy themselves just like they would if they were together. It’s the place we go to enjoy the banter and less of the work talk but also catch up on what is new with everyone. We have some employees that have had to cancel weddings, others are juggling work and kids, and some have significant others laid off or furloughed. We chat more as friends about all of this stuff and how its being handled rather than work related items.

text: Dang. I'm so sorry you had to deal with that <@UUQ0C0ZUH> :disappointed: I'm really sad that's what people are choosing to do with their time.

elements.text: Dang. I'm so sorry you had to deal with that
I'm really sad that's what people are choosing to do with their time.

text:
<@UUQ0C0ZUH> Wow, that's terrible. I've heard about Zoom meetings getting zoombombed (my son's speech teletherapy had to be moved from Zoom to GoToMeetings because of it). I'm sorry you and everyone else in the Zoom meeting experienced this!

The link to the Creative Mornings document Paul shared in this thread suggests that sharing the zoom link on social media makes meetings susceptible zoombombing.

elements.text:
Wow, that's terrible. I've heard about Zoom meetings getting zoombombed (my son's speech teletherapy had to be moved from Zoom to GoToMeetings because of it). I'm sorry you and everyone else in the Zoom meeting experienced this!

The link to the Creative Mornings document Paul shared in this thread suggests that sharing the zoom link on social media makes meetings susceptible zoombombing.

text:
We use:
• Slack - communicate with teams, collab on projects, etc.
• Zoom - for meetings and webinars
• HubSpot - CRM, Marketing Automation, blog site
• Wordpress - The rest of our website, use it so we can build and update whatever we want
• G Suite - For all content creation
• Notion - Collab/brainstorming space with my immediate team
• Miro - Visual communication/brainstorming
• Canva - When I don’t want to bug the design team
• Drift - Inbound sales conversations
• Appcues - In-software tutorials
• Beamer - For product updates
• Asana - For project management
• Used to use SEM Rush but got rid of it recently because we just weren’t seeing the value
• Gong - for reviewing sales calls and finding out what our customers’ pains are
• LinkedIn Live - for broadcasting to linkedin
• Streamyard - Streaming software that allows screen share and multiple channels and views
• Woopra - Data and tracking
• Wistia - Video hosting
• Google analytics - traffic/data capture
• Crazy egg - Heat maps
• Fullstory - Recorded user/audience sessions
• Salesforce - God only knows, like, everything

elements.text: Slack - communicate with teams, collab on projects, etc.

Wordpress - The rest of our website, use it so we can build and update whatever we want
G Suite - For all content creation
Notion - Collab/brainstorming space with my immediate team
Canva - When I don’t want to bug the design team

Gong - for reviewing sales calls and finding out what our customers’ pains are
LinkedIn Live - for broadcasting to linkedin
Streamyard - Streaming software that allows screen share and multiple channels and views
Salesforce - God only knows, like, everything

text:
We use:
• Slack - internal + external communication 
• Zoom - for meetings + webinars
• Pardot - marketing automation
• G Suite - content, docs, presentations
• Wistia - for video content hosting
• Drift - chatbot and inbound sales conversations
• Miro - whiteboarding and brainstorming collaboration
• Zapier - integrations 
• Google Analytics - website analytics and reporting
• Google Ads - ppc marketing
• Intercom - customer comms
• Salesforce - everything data-related
• Mode - data reporting
• Domo - data reporting
• Confluence - workspace information like briefs, how-to’s, misc. documentation
• Wordpress - website
• Unbounce - landing pages
• <http://Monday.com|Monday.com> - project management
• Crazy Egg - heat mapping
• Adobe CC - design-related projects
• Sketch - mockups and design
• Typeform - surveys
• MailShake - email outreach

elements.text: Drift - chatbot and inbound sales conversations
Google Analytics - website analytics and reporting
Confluence - workspace information like briefs, how-to’s, misc. documentation
